questions.question: TRIBUNAL : JUDGMENT :: LABORATORY : ____
questions.explanation: A tribunal delivers judgments; a laboratory conducts experiments.

questions.question: FRICTION : RESISTANCE :: MOMENTUM : ____
questions.explanation: Friction is a type of resistance; momentum is a type of motion.

questions.question: CONJECTURE : GUESS :: CORROBORATION : ____
questions.explanation: Conjecture is a guess; corroboration is confirmation.

questions.question: ARCANE : OBSCURE :: TRANSPARENT : ____
questions.explanation: Arcane means obscure; transparent means obvious.

questions.question: ADMONISH : WARN :: EXTOL : ____
questions.explanation: To admonish is to warn; to extol is to praise.

questions.question: BUREAUCRACY : REGULATIONS :: ANARCHY : ____
questions.explanation: Bureaucracy often involves many regulations; anarchy results in chaos.

questions.question: TEPID : WARM :: TORRID : ____
questions.explanation: Tepid is mildly warm; torrid is intensely hot.

questions.question: SEVER : CUT :: FORTIFY : ____
questions.explanation: Sever means cut completely; fortify means strengthen.

questions.question: IMPASSE : DEADLOCK :: CATALYST : ____
questions.explanation: An impasse is a deadlock; a catalyst is an accelerant.

questions.question: OATH : PROMISE :: DOGMA : ____
questions.explanation: Oath is a formal promise; dogma is a formal belief.

questions.question: COMMUTE : TRAVEL :: NEGOTIATE : ____
questions.explanation: Commute means to travel; negotiate means to bargain.

questions.question: PENCHANT : LIKING :: AVERSION : ____
questions.explanation: Penchant means strong liking; aversion means strong dislike.

questions.question: INDICTMENT : ACCUSATION :: VERDICT : ____
questions.explanation: An indictment is an accusation; a verdict is a decision.

questions.question: DEBILITATE : WEAKEN :: INVIGORATE : ____
questions.explanation: Debilitate means weaken; invigorate means energize.

questions.question: AUDIT : EXAMINE :: MEDIATE : ____
questions.explanation: An audit examines disputes; mediation resolves disputes.

questions.question: OBLIVIOUS : UNAWARE :: ASTUTE : ____
questions.explanation: Oblivious means unaware; astute means perceptive.

questions.question: HARBINGER : FORESHADOW :: EPILOGUE : ____
questions.explanation: A harbinger foreshadows events; an epilogue concludes them.

questions.question: RELINQUISH : SURRENDER :: ASSERT : ____
questions.explanation: Relinquish means surrender; assert means declare.

questions.question: RESONATE : ECHO :: PERMEATE : ____
questions.explanation: To resonate is to echo; to permeate is to spread throughout.

questions.question: IMPROVISE : PLAN :: IMPROVISE : PLAN :: RESTRAIN : ____
questions.explanation: To restrain is to limit, just as improvise opposes planning.

questions.question: FORTITUDE : COURAGE :: TENACITY : ____
questions.explanation: Fortitude is courage; tenacity is persistence.

questions.question: SOVEREIGNTY : NATION :: AUTONOMY : ____
questions.explanation: Sovereignty applies to nations; autonomy applies to individuals.

questions.question: REVERE : RESPECT :: DERIDE : ____
questions.explanation: To revere is to deeply respect; to deride is to mock.

questions.question: PROVIDE : SUPPLY :: CURTAIL : ____
questions.explanation: To curtail is to reduce; to provide is to supply.

questions.question: PRESUME : ASSUME :: EXTRAPOLATE : ____
questions.explanation: Presume means assume; extrapolate means infer.
